title: The First Book Burnings
description: Learn The First Book Burnings in one minute.

hook.text: In 213 BC, China's first emperor ordered every book in the country burned. Scholars who resisted were buried alive.

buildup.text: Emperor Qin Shi Huang wanted to erase all philosophies competing with his rule â€” especially Confucianism.

discovery.text: Scholars hid books in walls, caves, and graves. Many Confucian texts survived only because of these secret copies.

twist.text: Destroying books rarely destroys ideas â€” prohibition often makes forbidden texts more famous and desirable.

climax.text: Book burning has been repeated throughout history â€” by the Inquisition, Nazis, and many others.

punchline.text: Empires that burn books prove how much they fear words.

quiz.question: Why did Emperor Qin Shi Huang order books burned?
